summary: Frontend testing of redesigned Login and Registration pages. Both pages have modern split-screen layout with dark branding panel (left) and form (right), consistent with EaziWage website theme. Visual design is working. Mobile responsiveness and dark mode support verified. One critical bug found: Login error messages NOT displayed when invalid credentials submitted.

ui_bugs.issue: Error message not displayed when login fails with invalid credentials. API returns 401 but Alert component with data-testid='login-error' is not rendered.
ui_bugs.details: The error state is being set in auth.js (confirmed), but the conditional rendering {error && <Alert>...} in LoginPage.jsx is not showing the error. The element is completely absent from DOM after failed login.

action_items: FIX: LoginPage.jsx - Error message not rendering when login fails. The condition {error && <Alert>...} is not working. Need to verify error state propagation from login() function or check if component re-renders correctly.
critical_code_review_comments: LoginPage.jsx: Error handling issue - the error state from login() is not triggering re-render to show Alert component
Both auth pages have proper data-testid attributes for all interactive elements
ThemeContext integration appears correct for dark mode support

success_rate.frontend: 95% - 1 bug found (error message not displayed on failed login)

context_for_next_testing_agent: Auth pages redesigned with split-screen layout. Visual design is complete and consistent with EaziWage theme. One critical bug: login error messages not displayed (Alert component not rendering). Mobile responsiveness and dark mode support are working. The error state is set in auth.js but not reflected in UI - likely a React state/render issue in LoginPage.jsx.

login_page.form_card: white bg in light mode, dark green in dark mode

rca_of_issue.root_cause: The error state is set in auth.js via setAuthState(), but this global state change may not be triggering a re-render in LoginPage.jsx. The component uses local 'error' state via useState, which is set from login().error return value. Need to verify the login() function is returning the error correctly and setError() is being called.
reproduction_steps: Observe: API returns 401, but no error message appears on screen
rca_of_issue.expected_behavior: Alert component with data-testid='login-error' should appear showing 'Invalid email or password' or similar error message
rca_of_issue.actual_behavior: No error message displayed, form stays empty, user has no feedback about failed login
